item.title: Potholes are located approximately 120 metres before the 'slippery road' warning sign on the left-hand verge, when travelling from Cheltenham to Oxford, just before the dual carriageway starts on A40 near Shipton Oliffe, 26th January
item.description:
These potholes are located approximately 120 metres before the 'slippery road' warning sign on the left-hand verge, when travelling from Cheltenham to Oxford, just before the dual carriageway starts on A40 near Shipton Oliffe. The sign is visible from the pothole location and provides a fixed and unambiguous reference point. I am a daily commuter on this road. I struck these potholes several times while driving at normal road speed, as there aren't any room to maneuver with potholes on either side of the road. It causes noticeable jolts every time to the vehicle. Given the speed limit on this road and the presence of a warning sign relating to loss of control, the defect presents a significant hazard to vehicles, particularly in low-light or wet conditions. There is also another huge pothole just before the same slippery road sign. Please find attached the photographs showing the potholes in relation to the warning sign. I would be grateful if this defect could be inspected and repaired as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole outside 68a whaddon road on bus stop markings, 26th January
item.description:
Pothole reported fixed and it has not been. Buses travel over at speed making a very loud noise and causes the house the genuinely shake. This has been an issue for over 12 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68a, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
